thread.title: Gordon outduels Irving for 3-point crown | ABS-CBN News
thread.title_full: Gordon outduels Irving for 3-point crown | ABS-CBN News

author: Abs-Cbn News
title: Gordon outduels Irving for 3-point crown | ABS-CBN News
text:
Gordon outduels Irving for 3-point crown ABS-CBN News Posted at Feb 19 2017 10:39 AM | Updated as of Feb 19 2017 10:45 AM 
Share Houston Rockets guard Eric Gordon (10) celebrates winning the three-point contest during NBA All-Star Saturday Night at Smoothie King Center. Photo by Derick E. Hingle, USA TODAY Sports/Reuters 
Houston's Eric Gordon edged Cleveland's Kyrie Irving in a shootout to become the NBA's new three-point king in the JBL Three-Point Contest at NBA All-Star Saturday in New Orleans. 
Gordon and Irving were tied with 20 points each in the final round, after the Rockets' sixth man failed to convert the money-ball in his last rack. 
Irving had 18 points in the "overtime period," but Gordon did him better with 21 points, though he again missed the final money ball.
